article.description: Utah Valley State 69, TX A&M Corp Chris 64
article.headline: Utah Valley State 69, TX A&M Corp Chris 64
article.linkText: Utah Valley State 69, TX A&M Corp Chris 64
article.story: OREM, Utah (AP) -- David Heck scored 22 points to lead Utah Valley State to a 69-64 victory over Texas A&M-Corpus Christi Thursday night. Texas A&M-Corpus Christi (13-7) guard Aaron White drained a long 3-pointer to make it 67-64 with 15 seconds left, but Wolverine guard Matt Peterson hit two free throws for the final score. UVSC (9-11) scored its final seven points on free throws, and for the game was 24-for-26 from the line. The Wolverines led 36-32 at halftime. The lead changed hands several times early in the second half, but the momentum swung irrevocably in Utah Valley's favor after Texas A&M-Corpus Christi coach Ronnie Arrow got two straight technical fouls and was ejected with 15 minutes left in the game. Heck made all four of the free throws from the technical fouls to put UVSC ahead 49-42. Heck hit a 3-pointer from the top of the key 12 minutes left to cap a 15-2 Wolverine run and stretch the Utah Valley lead to 56-44. The Islanders scored nine straight points to pull within 60-54 with center Chris Daniels scoring a short catch-and-shoot jumper. Daniels led the Islanders with 15 points and nine rebounds, and White finished had 10 points, Heck was the only UVSC player to score in double figures, and he also had five assists, three blocked shots.
